alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Brown; Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 3:43AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cherry, northeastern Hooker, southwestern Brown, northwestern Blaine and Thomas Counties through 430 AM CDT/330 AM MDT/... At 343 AM CDT/243 AM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Merritt Reservoir to 10 miles northeast of Seneca to 11 miles south of Mullen. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Thedford, Halsey, Seneca, Purdum, Brownlee, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Merritt Reservoir, Elsmere, Wood Lake, Moon Lake, Willow Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Long Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Highway 83 crossing the North Loup River, Norway, Koshopah, Giant Hill, Big Alkali Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Natwick, Kelso and Highway 83 crossing Goose Creek. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 218 and 226. Highway 2 between mile markers 186 and 227. Highway 97 between mile markers 54 and 66, and between mile markers 101 and 118. Highway 83 between mile markers 140 and 196. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT/300 AM MDT/ for north central and west central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Brown; Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Thomas; Western Cherry
